title: The Wisdom of the Stained Glass
sub_title: Seeing God's Design in the Broken Pieces
devotional:
Eliza loved the stained glass windows of her church. Each pane, a jewel-toned fragment, seemed chaotic on its own. But when the sun streamed through, they coalesced into breathtaking scenes of biblical stories—Noah's Ark, the Good Shepherd, the Nativity. She often thought about how life was like those windows. We collect fragments of experiences, both joyful and painful, and it's difficult to see their purpose in the moment. Disappointments, betrayals, losses – they seem like random shards of broken glass, casting shadows instead of light. Yet, as we grow in faith and seek God's wisdom, we begin to understand how He takes these disparate pieces and weaves them into a beautiful tapestry of our lives.

Imagine a master craftsman painstakingly arranging each piece of glass, knowing exactly where it belongs to create the intended masterpiece. God, in His infinite wisdom, does the same with us. He knows the end from the beginning. He sees the grand design even when we only see the scattered fragments. What appears as random and chaotic is, in reality, divinely orchestrated.

This doesn't diminish the pain or negate the difficulty of life's challenges. It simply reframes them. Instead of viewing hardships as meaningless setbacks, we can see them as opportunities for growth, refinement, and deeper understanding. The sharp edges of those 'broken' pieces may be what's needed to define a part of the divine image. Consider the life of Joseph. Sold into slavery by his brothers, falsely accused and imprisoned, he endured immense suffering. Yet, through it all, God was at work, preparing him to become a leader who would save his family from famine (Genesis 45:5). Joseph, in his wisdom and grace, recognized that even the most painful events had served a greater purpose in God's plan.

Today, reflect on the 'stained glass' of your own life. What seemingly random or painful events have shaped who you are? Can you see, even in a small way, how God might be using those experiences to create something beautiful? Seek His wisdom and trust that He is the Master Craftsman, weaving all things together for good.
image_description: A close-up of a stained glass window in a church, with sunlight streaming through, illuminating the intricate details of the colorful glass.
insights: Proverbs 4:7 says, 'Wisdom is the principal thing; therefore get wisdom. And in all your getting, get understanding.' This verse underscores the paramount importance of seeking wisdom in all aspects of our lives. James 1:5 encourages us to ask God for wisdom, promising that He will give it generously to all who ask in faith, without doubting. These verses remind us that wisdom is not merely intellectual knowledge but a divine gift that enables us to discern God's will and navigate life's complexities with clarity and purpose.
prayer: Heavenly Father, I confess that I often struggle to understand the purpose of my trials and hardships. Help me to trust in Your wisdom, even when I can't see the grand design. Grant me the grace to learn from my experiences and to see how You are weaving all things together for my good and Your glory. Increase my faith and help me seek your understanding in everything. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: Identify a challenging experience in your life. How has it shaped you? What lessons did you learn? How might God be using it for a greater purpose? Take some time to pray and ask God for wisdom to see the situation from His perspective.
